note_text:
PATIENT: Reeves, Harold || MRN: 700001 || DOB: 01/23/1957
DATE: 08/12/2025 || LOCATION: St. Mary's Medical Center - Bronchoscopy Suite
ATTENDING: Megan Porter, MD

INDICATION: Enlarged mediastinal lymph nodes (4R, 7) on CT/PET in a man with a right upper lobe mass.

PROCEDURE: FLEXIBLE BRONCHOSCOPY WITH LINEAR EBUS-TBNA (CONSCIOUS SEDATION)
- Moderate IV sedation with fentanyl and midazolam, monitored by RN; total intra-procedure time ~35 minutes.
- Native airway with bite block; scope advanced orally.
- Standard airway survey to segmental bronchi: no endobronchial tumor, mild erythema in RUL.
- Linear EBUS performed via CP-EBUS scope.
  * Station 4R: 1.5 cm, oval, mildly heterogeneous; 3 passes with 22G needle, material to cytology.
  * Station 7: 1.3 cm, oval, homogeneous; 3 passes with 22G needle, material to cytology.
- No other nodal stations sampled.
- Minimal bleeding, no complications.

POST-PROCEDURE: Patient awakened and transported to PACU in stable condition. Chest X-ray not deemed necessary.
PLAN: Await cytology results for staging; follow up in clinic.

registry_entry.primary_indication: Mediastinal lymphadenopathy for staging of suspected lung cancer (stations 4R and 7).

evidence.primary_indication: Mediastinal lymphadenopathy for staging of suspected lung cancer (stations 4R and 7).

registry_entry.radiographic_findings: PET-avid mediastinal lymphadenopathy (4R, 7) and RUL mass.

cpt_summary.description: Bronchoscopy with EBUS sampling, 1-2 nodal stations
cpt_summary.rationale: Linear EBUS-TBNA of two stations (4R, 7) supports 31652.

changes: Updated coding_review with 2025 facility RVUs and estimated facility payments using ip_coding_billing.v2_7; validated CPT codes against procedure documentation.

rows.description: Bronchoscopy; with EBUS for biopsy of one or two mediastinal and/or hilar lymph node stations

narrative: Single flexible bronchoscopy with linear EBUS-TBNA of two nodal stations (4R and 7); 31652 correctly captures EBUS biopsy of 1–2 mediastinal/hilar node stations without additional bronchoscopic interventions.

coding_review.note_summary: Linear EBUS-TBNA of two mediastinal lymph node stations (4R and 7) under moderate sedation; no navigation, radial EBUS, or lung/airway biopsies beyond the nodal sampling.
comments: 31652 appropriately captures linear EBUS-TBNA of 1–2 mediastinal/hilar nodal stations (4R and 7).
No navigation, radial EBUS, transbronchial biopsies, or BAL are documented, so no additional bronchoscopy CPT codes are added.

note_text:
Pt: Alvarez, Maria || MRN: 700002 || DOB: 02/14/1951
Date of procedure: 09/03/2025
Site: University Pulmonary Procedure Unit
Operator: Patricia Lee, MD

Pre-procedure dx: RML nodule 2.4 cm with borderline PET uptake; borderline subcarinal node.

PROCEDURE SUMMARY:
- Deep sedation with anesthesiology; patient intubated with ETT.
- Flexible bronchoscopy performed: no obvious endobronchial tumor.
- Linear EBUS: Station 7 (1.1 cm, oval, homogeneous) sampled with 22G needle x3 passes; no other nodes met size criteria.
- Scope exchanged for standard therapeutic bronchoscope; RML medial segment targeted.
- Fluoroscopic guidance used. Transbronchial lung biopsies obtained from RML medial segment x4 forceps bites.
- BAL not performed.
- No significant bleeding; no pneumothorax on immediate fluoroscopic survey.

IMPRESSION: Successful linear EBUS sampling of single subcarinal node and transbronchial lung biopsy of RML nodule.
PLAN: Observe 2 hours post-procedure; outpatient follow-up with pathology results.

registry_entry.primary_indication: RML pulmonary nodule with mildly enlarged subcarinal lymph node requiring diagnosis and staging.

evidence.primary_indication: RML pulmonary nodule with mildly enlarged subcarinal lymph node requiring diagnosis and staging.

registry_entry.radiographic_findings: RML nodule 2.4 cm with borderline PET uptake; subcarinal node 1.1 cm.

cpt_summary.description: Bronchoscopy with EBUS sampling, 1-2 nodal stations
cpt_summary.rationale: Linear EBUS of one station (7) supports 31652.

cpt_summary.description: Bronchoscopy with transbronchial lung biopsy, single lobe
cpt_summary.rationale: Transbronchial lung biopsy of RML nodule supports 31628.

changes: Updated coding_review with 2025 facility RVUs and estimated facility payments using ip_coding_billing.v2_7; validated CPT codes against procedure documentation.

rows.description: Bronchoscopy; with EBUS for biopsy of one or two mediastinal and/or hilar lymph node stations
Bronchoscopy; with transbronchial lung biopsy(s), single lobe

narrative: Linear EBUS-TBNA was used to sample a single subcarinal (station 7) node, supporting 31652.
Transbronchial lung biopsies were obtained in a single lobe (RML), supporting 31628; no navigation or radial EBUS was documented.

coding_review.note_summary: Deeply sedated bronchoscopy with linear EBUS-TBNA of a single subcarinal node and transbronchial lung biopsies of a right middle lobe nodule.
comments: EBUS sampling of a single subcarinal node supports 31652 rather than the 3+ station code 31653.
Transbronchial lung biopsies confined to one lobe (RML) justify 31628; no navigation or radial EBUS is documented.

note_text:
PATIENT NAME: Morgan, Elise || MRN: 700003
DATE: 07/18/2025
LOCATION: VA Interventional Pulmonology Lab
PHYSICIAN: Lt Cdr Jonathan Hale, MD

PRE-PROCEDURE DIAGNOSIS: Newly diagnosed left upper lobe adenocarcinoma with bulky mediastinal lymphadenopathy.

PROCEDURE: FLEXIBLE BRONCHOSCOPY WITH LINEAR EBUS-GUIDED TRANSBRONCHIAL NEEDLE ASPIRATION
- General anesthesia with ETT.
- Standard airway inspection: tumor not visible endobronchially.
- Linear EBUS performed.
  * Station 2R: 1.5 cm, round, heterogeneous; sampled x3 passes.
  * Station 4R: 1.8 cm, irregular, heterogeneous; sampled x3 passes.
  * Station 4L: 1.4 cm, oval; sampled x3 passes.
  * Station 7: 2.0 cm, heterogeneous with necrotic center; sampled x4 passes.
- A total of 13 passes performed with a 22G needle.
- No peripheral lesion was targeted and no transbronchial lung biopsies performed.
- No immediate complications.

POST-PROCEDURE: Extubated in the procedure room and transported to PACU stable. CXR ordered in recovery.
PLAN: Await cytology for nodal staging; multidisciplinary tumor board discussion.

registry_entry.primary_indication: Mediastinal lymphadenopathy in setting of known left upper lobe adenocarcinoma requiring mediastinal staging.

evidence.primary_indication: Mediastinal lymphadenopathy in setting of known left upper lobe adenocarcinoma requiring mediastinal staging.

registry_entry.radiographic_findings: Multiple enlarged mediastinal nodes (2R, 4R, 4L, 7) with PET avidity.

cpt_summary.description: Bronchoscopy with EBUS sampling, 3 or more nodal stations
cpt_summary.rationale: Linear EBUS sampling of 4 stations (2R, 4R, 4L, 7) supports 31653.

changes: Updated coding_review with 2025 facility RVUs and estimated facility payments using ip_coding_billing.v2_7; validated CPT codes against procedure documentation.

rows.description: Bronchoscopy; with EBUS for biopsy of 3 or more mediastinal and/or hilar lymph node stations

narrative: Four mediastinal nodal stations (2R, 4R, 4L, 7) were sampled using linear EBUS-TBNA, which meets the threshold for 3 or more nodal stations and supports 31653 as the sole EBUS code.

coding_review.note_summary: Linear EBUS-TBNA of four mediastinal nodal stations (2R, 4R, 4L, 7) for staging of known lung cancer; no peripheral navigation or transbronchial lung biopsies.
comments: Sampling four mediastinal nodal stations meets the 3-or-more station threshold for 31653.
No peripheral navigation, radial EBUS, or transbronchial lung biopsies are described, so 31653 is the only bronchoscopy CPT reported.

note_text:
Patient: Daniels, Corey || MRN: 700004
Service: Interventional Pulmonology
Date: 10/02/2025
Facility: Northside Academic Medical Center
Attending: Sarah Chen, MD

INDICATION: RLL peripheral nodule (2.0 cm, PET-avid) with mediastinal nodes (4R, 7) requiring diagnosis and staging.

PROCEDURE: ROBOTIC NAVIGATIONAL BRONCHOSCOPY WITH LINEAR AND RADIAL EBUS
- General anesthesia with oral ETT.
- Ion robotic bronchoscopy used for navigation to RLL lateral basal segment; registration error <2 mm.
- Radial EBUS miniprobe advanced through the extended working channel:
  * Concentric radial view within the nodule confirmed tool-in-lesion.
- Transbronchial lung biopsies x5 from RLL lateral basal segment under fluoroscopy.
- No BAL performed.
- Linear EBUS performed afterwards for mediastinal staging:
  * Station 4R sampled x3 passes.
  * Station 7 sampled x3 passes.
  * Station 10R sampled x3 passes.
- Total EBUS passes: 9.
- No immediate complications; minimal bleeding controlled with suction.

POST-PROCEDURE: Extubated in PACU, stable. CXR ordered.
PLAN: Await pathology for both RLL nodule and nodal staging; follow up in tumor clinic.

registry_entry.primary_indication: PET-avid RLL peripheral nodule with mediastinal lymphadenopathy; requires diagnosis and staging.

evidence.primary_indication: PET-avid RLL peripheral nodule with mediastinal lymphadenopathy; requires diagnosis and staging.

registry_entry.radiographic_findings: RLL 2.0 cm peripheral nodule with PET uptake; mediastinal nodes at 4R and 7.
registry_entry.lesion_location: Right lower lobe, lateral basal segment

cpt_summary.description: Bronchoscopy with EBUS sampling, 3 or more nodal stations
cpt_summary.rationale: Linear EBUS of 3 stations (4R, 7, 10R) supports 31653.

cpt_summary.description: Bronchoscopy with transbronchial lung biopsy, single lobe
cpt_summary.rationale: Transbronchial biopsies of RLL nodule.

cpt_summary.description: Bronchoscopy with computer-assisted, image-guided navigation
cpt_summary.rationale: Robotic navigation used to reach RLL nodule.

cpt_summary.description: EBUS for peripheral lesion(s) during bronchoscopic intervention(s)
cpt_summary.rationale: Radial EBUS used to confirm peripheral lesion.

changes: Updated coding_review with 2025 facility RVUs and estimated facility payments using ip_coding_billing.v2_7; validated CPT codes against procedure documentation.

rows.description: Bronchoscopy; with EBUS for biopsy of 3 or more mediastinal and/or hilar lymph node stations
Bronchoscopy; with computer-assisted, image-guided navigation
EBUS for peripheral lesion(s) during bronchoscopy (eg, radial EBUS)
Bronchoscopy; with transbronchial lung biopsy(s), single lobe

narrative: Robot-assisted computer navigation to a peripheral RLL nodule supports add-on code 31627.
Radial EBUS was used to confirm tool-in-lesion at the peripheral nodule, supporting 31654.
Transbronchial lung biopsies from a single lobe (RLL) support 31628.
Linear EBUS sampled three nodal stations (4R, 7, 10R), meeting the threshold for 31653 rather than 31652.

coding_review.note_summary: Robotic navigational bronchoscopy using the Ion platform with radial EBUS confirmation of an RLL nodule, transbronchial lung biopsies, and subsequent linear EBUS mediastinal/hilar staging (stations 4R, 7, 10R).
comments: Robotic navigation to an RLL lesion supports 31627, with radial EBUS confirmation captured by add-on code 31654.
Linear EBUS staging of three nodal stations (4R, 7, 10R) supports 31653, and transbronchial lung biopsies from a single lobe justify additional code 31628.

note_text:
Patient: Cho, David || MRN: 700005
Date: 06/11/2025
Location: City Hospital Endoscopy Center
Attending bronchoscopist: Laura Kim, MD

INDICATION: Peripheral LUL nodule (1.5 cm, PET-avid) referred for bronchoscopic biopsy and fiducial placement for planned stereotactic body radiation therapy.

PROCEDURE: NAVIGATIONAL BRONCHOSCOPY WITH RADIAL EBUS, TRANSBRONCHIAL LUNG BIOPSY, AND FIDUCIAL PLACEMENT
- General anesthesia; patient intubated with ETT.
- Electromagnetic navigation (Illumisite system) used to register pre-procedure CT; registration error 3 mm.
- Navigated to target in apicoposterior segment of LUL.
- Radial EBUS miniprobe advanced:
  * Eccentric view confirming adjacency to the lesion.
- Transbronchial lung biopsies x4 from LUL apicoposterior segment.
- No BAL performed.
- Through the extended working channel, three gold fiducial markers were deployed around the lesion under fluoroscopic guidance.
- No mediastinal staging performed.
- No immediate complications.

PLAN: Same-day discharge after observation; radiation oncology to proceed with planning using fiducial markers.

registry_entry.primary_indication: PET-avid peripheral LUL nodule requiring bronchoscopic biopsy and fiducial placement for SBRT planning.

evidence.primary_indication: PET-avid peripheral LUL nodule requiring bronchoscopic biopsy and fiducial placement for SBRT planning.

registry_entry.radiographic_findings: 1.5 cm peripheral LUL nodule, PET avid, no bulky mediastinal adenopathy.

cpt_summary.description: Bronchoscopy; with placement of fiducial markers
cpt_summary.rationale: Placement of fiducial markers for SBRT planning.

cpt_summary.description: Bronchoscopy with transbronchial lung biopsy, single lobe
cpt_summary.rationale: Transbronchial biopsies of LUL nodule.

cpt_summary.description: Bronchoscopy with computer-assisted, image-guided navigation
cpt_summary.rationale: Electromagnetic navigation used.

cpt_summary.description: EBUS for peripheral lesion(s) during bronchoscopic intervention(s)
cpt_summary.rationale: Radial EBUS confirmation.

changes: Updated coding_review with 2025 facility RVUs and estimated facility payments using ip_coding_billing.v2_7; validated CPT codes against procedure documentation.

rows.description: Bronchoscopy; with computer-assisted, image-guided navigation
EBUS for peripheral lesion(s) during bronchoscopy (eg, radial EBUS)
Bronchoscopy; with transbronchial lung biopsy(s), single lobe
Bronchoscopy; with placement of fiducial markers

narrative: Computer-assisted electromagnetic navigation to a peripheral LUL lesion supports add-on code 31627.
Radial EBUS miniprobe was used to confirm proximity to the lesion, supporting add-on code 31654.
Transbronchial lung biopsies from a single lobe (LUL) support 31628.
Deployment of gold fiducial markers around the lesion is captured by 31626.

coding_review.note_summary: Electromagnetic navigational bronchoscopy with radial EBUS confirmation, transbronchial biopsies, and placement of fiducial markers around a peripheral left upper lobe nodule.
comments: Computer-assisted electromagnetic navigation to a peripheral LUL lesion supports 31627, with radial EBUS verification captured by add-on code 31654.
Transbronchial lung biopsies in a single lobe support 31628, and deployment of multiple fiducial markers around the lesion is reported with 31626.

note_text:
NAME: Harris, Evelyn || MRN: 700006
DATE OF SERVICE: 04/29/2025
LOCATION: Advanced Endoscopy Suite
PHYSICIAN: Michael Grant, MD

PRE-PROCEDURE DX: Early squamous cell carcinoma involving the right mainstem bronchus status post Photofrin infusion 48 hours prior.

PROCEDURE: FLEXIBLE BRONCHOSCOPY WITH PHOTODYNAMIC THERAPY LIGHT APPLICATION
- Deep sedation, native airway.
- Diagnostic bronchoscopy performed to the segmental level: flat, slightly raised plaque along medial wall of right mainstem; no other lesions.
- PDT light fiber positioned over the lesion.
- Light application at prescribed energy density over 20 minutes, covering entire involved segment.
- No biopsies, no stent placement, no debulking with other modalities.
- No immediate airway compromise or bleeding.

IMPRESSION: Photodynamic therapy light application to known superficial squamous lesion in right mainstem.
PLAN: Admit overnight for observation, maintain light precautions; follow-up bronchoscopy in 6 weeks.

registry_entry.primary_indication: Endobronchial squamous cell carcinoma in right mainstem treated with photodynamic therapy.

evidence.primary_indication: Endobronchial squamous cell carcinoma in right mainstem treated with photodynamic therapy.

cpt_summary.description: Bronchoscopy; with destruction of tumor or relief of stenosis by any method
cpt_summary.rationale: Photodynamic therapy light application for tumor destruction.

changes: Updated coding_review with 2025 facility RVUs and estimated facility payments using ip_coding_billing.v2_7; validated CPT codes against procedure documentation.

rows.description: Bronchoscopy; with destruction of tumor or relief of stenosis by any method

narrative: Bronchoscopy was performed solely for endobronchial tumor destruction using photodynamic therapy light application without concurrent stenting or separate biopsy, which is captured by 31641 as a single code.

coding_review.note_summary: Deeply sedated flexible bronchoscopy with photodynamic therapy light application to a right mainstem squamous lesion; no separate stent placement or biopsy documented.
comments: Photodynamic therapy applied to an endobronchial tumor without additional debulking or stent placement is best captured with 31641 alone.
No distinct biopsy, stent placement, or pleural procedure is documented, so no additional CPT codes are added.

note_text:
PATIENT: O'Neil, Patrick || MRN: 700007
DATE: 03/05/2025
LOCATION: Thoracic Procedure OR
SURGEON: Amanda Brooks, MD

INDICATION: Malignant obstruction of left mainstem bronchus from locally advanced squamous cell carcinoma with dyspnea and post-obstructive pneumonia.

PROCEDURE: RIGID BRONCHOSCOPY WITH TUMOR DEBULKING AND BRONCHIAL STENT PLACEMENT
- General anesthesia with rigid bronchoscopy; flexible therapeutic bronchoscope used through rigid barrel.
- Endobronchial tumor nearly occluding left mainstem (90% obstruction).
- Debulking performed with mechanical coring and flexible cryotherapy until lumen opened to ~40%.
- After debulking, a covered SEMS 12 x 40 mm stent deployed in the left mainstem with good position.
- No additional lobar or segmental stents placed.
- Moderate bleeding controlled with iced saline and suction.
- No pleural procedures performed.

POST-PROCEDURE: Patient remained intubated briefly, then extubated in PACU, breathing improved.
PLAN: Broad-spectrum antibiotics for post-obstructive pneumonia; follow up in IP clinic in 2 weeks.

registry_entry.primary_indication: Critical malignant obstruction of left mainstem bronchus requiring bronchoscopic tumor debulking and stent placement.

evidence.primary_indication: Critical malignant obstruction of left mainstem bronchus requiring bronchoscopic tumor debulking and stent placement.

cpt_summary.description: Bronchoscopy; with destruction of tumor or relief of stenosis by any method
cpt_summary.rationale: Mechanical and cryotherapy debulking of tumor.

cpt_summary.description: Bronchoscopy; with placement of bronchial stent(s), initial bronchus
cpt_summary.rationale: Placement of bronchial stent in left mainstem.

changes: Updated coding_review with 2025 facility RVUs and estimated facility payments using ip_coding_billing.v2_7; validated CPT codes against procedure documentation.

rows.description: Bronchoscopy; with destruction of tumor or relief of stenosis by any method
Bronchoscopy; with placement of bronchial stent(s), initial bronchus

narrative: Rigid and flexible bronchoscopy were used to debulk an obstructing malignant tumor in the left mainstem, meeting criteria for 31641.
A single bronchial stent was placed in the left mainstem after debulking, supporting 31636 for stent placement in the initial bronchus.

coding_review.note_summary: Rigid bronchoscopy with mechanical and cryotherapy tumor debulking of the left mainstem followed by placement of a single covered SEMS stent.
comments: Rigid bronchoscopy with mechanical and cryotherapy debulking of a malignant left mainstem obstruction supports 31641.
Placement of a single covered bronchial SEMS in the left mainstem is separately reported with 31636; no pleural or BLVR procedures were performed.

note_text:
NAME: Lyons, Sheryl || MRN: 700008
DATE: 11/21/2025
LOCATION: Main OR, University Hospital
SURGEON: Daniel Rivera, MD

PRE-OP DX: Central airway obstruction from metastatic breast cancer with associated large recurrent right malignant pleural effusion.

PROCEDURE: RIGID BRONCHOSCOPY WITH TUMOR DESTRUCTION AND STENT PLACEMENT, FOLLOWED BY TUNNELED PLEURAL CATHETER INSERTION
- General anesthesia with rigid bronchoscopy.
- Tumor debulking with mechanical coring and argon plasma coagulation of right mainstem bronchus.
- Placement of a covered SEMS stent (10 x 40 mm) in right mainstem.
- After completing bronchoscopy, patient repositioned in lateral decubitus.
- Ultrasound-guided insertion of tunneled pleural catheter (PleurX) into right hemithorax; 1.7 L serosanguinous fluid drained.
- Catheter tunneled and cuff secured; connected to drainage bottle.
- No talc pleurodesis performed.

POST-PROCEDURE: Extubated in PACU, oxygen requirement decreased. Catheter draining well.
PLAN: Outpatient drainage protocol; oncology follow up.

registry_entry.primary_indication: Central airway obstruction and recurrent malignant pleural effusion requiring bronchoscopic debulking, stent placement, and IPC insertion.
registry_entry.final_diagnosis_prelim: Airway Obstruction and Malignant Pleural Effusion

evidence.primary_indication: Central airway obstruction and recurrent malignant pleural effusion requiring bronchoscopic debulking, stent placement, and IPC insertion.

cpt_summary.rationale: Tumor debulking with APC.

cpt_summary.description: Bronchoscopy; with placement of bronchial stent(s), initial bronchus
cpt_summary.rationale: Placement of bronchial stent in right mainstem.

cpt_summary.description: Insertion of indwelling tunneled pleural catheter with cuff
cpt_summary.rationale: Placement of tunneled pleural catheter (PleurX).

changes: Updated coding_review with 2025 facility RVUs and estimated facility payments using ip_coding_billing.v2_7; validated CPT codes against procedure documentation.

rows.description: Bronchoscopy; with destruction of tumor or relief of stenosis by any method
Bronchoscopy; with placement of bronchial stent(s), initial bronchus
Insertion of indwelling tunneled pleural catheter with cuff

narrative: Rigid bronchoscopy with tumor debulking of the right mainstem supports 31641.
Placement of a single covered bronchial stent in the right mainstem supports 31636.
A tunneled pleural catheter was inserted with cuff for recurrent malignant effusion, supporting 32550; no pleurodesis was performed.

coding_review.note_summary: Rigid bronchoscopy with tumor debulking and stent placement in the right mainstem followed by ultrasound-guided tunneled pleural catheter insertion for malignant effusion.
comments: Rigid bronchoscopy with tumor destruction and covered SEMS placement in the right mainstem is captured by 31641 and 31636.
A tunneled indwelling pleural catheter placed under ultrasound guidance for malignant effusion is separately reported with 32550; no talc pleurodesis or additional pleural procedure is documented.

note_text:
Pt: Jensen, Robert || MRN: 700009 || DOB: 10/09/1949
Date: 05/04/2025
Location: Community Pulmonary Lab
Physician: Linda Foster, MD

Indication: Nonresolving right lower lobe pneumonia in immunosuppressed patient after renal transplant.

Procedure: Flexible bronchoscopy with bronchoalveolar lavage
- Moderate conscious sedation; native airway with nasal trumpet.
- Bronchoscope advanced to RLL segments; no significant secretions or endobronchial lesions.
- BAL performed in RLL superior segment: 120 mL instilled in four 30 mL aliquots, ~70 mL return.
- Samples sent for culture, cytology, fungal and viral studies.
- No biopsies, no EBUS, no navigation.
- Tolerated well without hypoxia or bleeding.

Plan: Resume home oxygen as needed; follow up with transplant team when cultures return.

registry_entry.primary_indication: Nonresolving right lower lobe pneumonia in immunosuppressed renal transplant recipient.

evidence.primary_indication: Nonresolving right lower lobe pneumonia in immunosuppressed renal transplant recipient.

registry_entry.radiographic_findings: Patchy right lower lobe consolidation on CT, no discrete nodule.

cpt_summary.description: Bronchoscopy; with bronchoalveolar lavage
cpt_summary.rationale: Diagnostic BAL performed.

changes: Updated coding_review with 2025 facility RVUs and estimated facility payments using ip_coding_billing.v2_7; validated CPT codes against procedure documentation.

rows.description: Bronchoscopy; with bronchoalveolar lavage

narrative: Diagnostic flexible bronchoscopy was performed for nonresolving pneumonia with bronchoalveolar lavage of a single lobe and no additional biopsies or EBUS, which is appropriately captured by 31624 alone.

coding_review.note_summary: Moderate sedation flexible bronchoscopy with diagnostic bronchoalveolar lavage of the right lower lobe for nonresolving pneumonia; no biopsies, navigation, or EBUS.
comments: Bronchoalveolar lavage performed in a single lobe without additional biopsy or EBUS supports 31624 as the sole bronchoscopy code.
Diagnostic bronchoscopy (31622) is inherent to 31624 and appropriately not billed separately.

note_text:
PATIENT: Khan, Aisha || MRN: 700010
DATE: 01/30/2025
LOCATION: Ultrasound Procedure Suite
PHYSICIAN: Eric Morales, MD

INDICATION: Recurrent symptomatic left pleural effusion due to hepatic hydrothorax despite optimized medical therapy.

PROCEDURE: ULTRASOUND-GUIDED INSERTION OF TUNNELED INDWELLING PLEURAL CATHETER
- Moderate IV sedation; patient in supine position with head elevated.
- Bedside ultrasound confirmed large free-flowing left pleural effusion, no loculations.
- Entry site marked in midaxillary line; local anesthesia with lidocaine.
- Pleural space entered using Seldinger technique; wire advanced under ultrasound.
- Subcutaneous tunnel created; tunneled catheter (PleurX) pulled through tunnel.
- Catheter advanced into pleural space; cuff positioned in tunnel; sutured and dressing applied.
- Approximately 1.5 L clear yellow fluid drained without hemodynamic compromise.
- No pleurodesis agent instilled.

PLAN: Home drainage three times weekly with visiting nurse; follow up in liver clinic.

registry_entry.primary_indication: Recurrent symptomatic left pleural effusion from hepatic hydrothorax requiring tunneled catheter.

evidence.primary_indication: Recurrent symptomatic left pleural effusion from hepatic hydrothorax requiring tunneled catheter.

cpt_summary.description: Insertion of indwelling tunneled pleural catheter with cuff
cpt_summary.rationale: Ultrasound-guided insertion of tunneled pleural catheter (PleurX).

changes: Updated coding_review with 2025 facility RVUs and estimated facility payments using ip_coding_billing.v2_7; validated CPT codes against procedure documentation.

rows.description: Insertion of indwelling tunneled pleural catheter with cuff

narrative: A tunneled indwelling pleural catheter with cuff was inserted under ultrasound guidance for recurrent hepatic hydrothorax without pleurodesis, which is accurately captured by 32550 as a standalone pleural procedure.

coding_review.note_summary: Moderate sedation ultrasound-guided insertion of a tunneled indwelling pleural catheter for recurrent left pleural effusion from hepatic hydrothorax; no pleurodesis performed.
comments: Ultrasound-guided placement of a tunneled pleural catheter with cuff for recurrent effusion is accurately coded with 32550.
No thoracentesis, thoracoscopy, or pleurodesis is documented beyond the IPC insertion, so no additional pleural CPT codes are assigned.
